business.headline: US imposes 25% tariff on India: What it means for exports and key sectorsThe newly announced duties target several of India's top-performing export sectors. Automobiles, auto components, steel, aluminum, smartphones, solar modules, marine products, gems, jewellery, and select processed food and agricultural items are all on the 25% list.

How the subscription lifestyle is fuelling a new wave of debtFrom entertainment and food to wellness and shopping, subscription models are everywhere. While they promise convenience, they're also leading many into silent debt traps, especially the younger, digital-savvy crowd.
Sensex closes 144 points higher, Nifty above 24,800; L&T up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 143.91 points to close at 81,481.86, while the NSE Nifty50 added 33.95 points to end at 24,855.05.

M&B Engineering IPO: Should you subscribe? Check GMP, subscription on Day 1The IPO consists of a fresh equity issue worth Rs 275 crore and an offer-for-sale (OFS) worth Rs 375 crore by the company's promoters.

Only 1.35% central government staff opt for Unified Pension Scheme. Here's whyAs of July 20, 2025, only 30,989 employees have chosen UPS out of approximately 23 lakh (2.3 million) employees enrolled in NPS, marking a participation rate of just 1.35%.

How Pune man's insurance claim was denied thrice, then cleared after viral postWhile his wife was hospitalised, Sumit Kumar, a Pune-based business consultant, was battling paperwork, policy fine print, and silence from his insurer. This is his story.

NSDL IPO fully booked: Should you subscribe or skip Rs 4,000 crore listing?National Securities Depository Ltd (NSDL) aims to raise Rs 4,011.60 crore through a complete offer for sale (OFS) of 5.01 crore equity shares by existing shareholders.

NSDL IPO Day 1: Check latest subscription status, GMP and moreIn the grey market, NSDL's shares are commanding a premium of Rs 126, implying an estimated listing price of Rs 926—around 15.75 percent higher than the issue price.
TCS CEO's salary in focus amid mass layoff plan. Here's how much he earnsTCS recently confirmed it will let go of about 2% of its workforce in FY26, which translates to roughly 12,000 employees.

Infosys to hire 20,000 freshers in 2025, focus on AI: ReportInfosys CEO said that the IT firm has made early investments in AI and training its staff. So far, the company has trained about 2.75 lakh employees at different levels in AI and related areas.

ITR-3 online filing begins: Are you eligible and what's new?The Income Tax Department has kick-started online filing for ITR-3, bringing relief to taxpayers with more complex income sources. If you're wondering whether this applies to you and what's changed this year, here's everything in simple terms.

Talk money like you talk love: Investment advisor's advice for newlywedsAn investment advisor's advice to young couples goes beyond numbers. Abhishek Kumar emphasises that financial clarity is just as essential as emotional honesty when building a strong, lasting marriage.

entertainment.headline: Mrunal Thakur gets a pre-birthday surprise on Dacoit sets, Adivi Sesh shares videoActor Mrunal Thakur, who turns 33 on July 31, was surprised with an early birthday celebration by the cast and crew of her upcoming film 'Dacoit'. Co-star Adivi Sesh shared a glimpse of the celebration on social media.

Farah Khan takes her cook Dilip to Maldives, begins new travel vlog seriesFarah Khan has started a fun travel vlog with her cook Dilip. She took Dilip on his first international trip to the Maldives. In her latest vlog, they were seen enjoying local food.

Ektaa Kapoor recalls Smriti Irani was mother Shobha's pick for TulsiActor Smriti Irani reprised her iconic role as Tulsi Virani in the reboot of 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi'. In a live chat, producer Ektaa Kapoor wanted only Smriti as the lead character since she found her similar to actor Twinkle Khanna.

AI meets sci-fi in Shekhar Kapur's new series Warlord. Teaser outFrom Bollywood legend to digital pioneer, Shekhar Kapur isn't just making a series; he's launching a new era of storytelling with 'Warlord'. The teaser of the film has been released, and it is AI-generated.

Prabhudeva, Simran, Meena, other 90s South Indian stars reunite in Goa. Viral picsA reunion in Goa brought together leading South Indian film personalities from the '90s for a celebration of cinema and friendship. From directors like KS Ravikumar and S Shankar, to actors like Simran, Meena, Prabhudeva and others, were present.

Happy Gilmore 2 is Adam Sandler's biggest Netflix opener with 46.7 million viewsAdam Sandler's 'Happy Gilmore 2' has smashed records with 46.7 million views in three days, becoming the biggest opening weekend for any Netflix film in the US. The sequel has reignited nostalgia for the original, while blending humour and heart to captivate audiences worldwide.

The Summer I Turned Pretty just got its most twist-the-knife-in-your-heart episode'The Summer I Turned Pretty' Season 3, Episode 4: Belly and Jeremiah plan their wedding, but not without the emotional fallout from her strained relationship with her mother and Conrad's quiet heartbreak.

Anupam Kher on Tanvi vs Saiyaara box office: Even SRK bounces back after 4 flopsVeteran actor Anupam Kher launched his book 'Different But No Less' on Wednesday. While talking to IndiaToday.in about the book, which is based on his film 'Tanvi: The Great', the actor shared how the box office performance doesn't matter so much because he believes in the film's wholesome journey.

Elvish Yadav begins acting career with web series set in BhopalElvish Yadav has started shooting for his acting debut in a new web series in Bhopal. This move marks a significant shift from his digital comedy roots to mainstream acting.

KPop Demon Hunters is Netflix's most-watched animated film with 26.3 million views'KPop Demon Hunters' has emerged as Netflix's most-watched original animated film, captivating audiences with its unique blend of K-pop culture and supernatural action. The film's popularity is further amplified by its chart-topping soundtrack and engaging storyline.

Kartik Aaryan shoots for Tu Meri Main Tera with Ananya, Jackie Shroff at Taj MahalActor Kartik Aaryan is shooting for his upcoming film 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri' at the Taj Mahal in Agra. His co-stars Ananya Panday and Jackie Shroff were also clicked at the venue. Several videos of the actors have now surfaced on social media.

Aamir Khan on declining Rs 125 crore OTT deal: Was advised against itAamir Khan recently opened up about declining a lucrative OTT deal for 'Sitaare Zameen Par'. The actor, in an interaction, mentioned how he was advised by many to not make such a move.

Kingdom: A make or break film for Vijay DeverakondaAfter a series of commercial failures, Vijay Deverakonda takes a reflective turn with 'Kingdom', a politically charged spy thriller. The film is seen as his most important work since 'Arjun Reddy', focusing on strong storytelling over spectacle.

Simbu-Vetri Maaran film not shelved, film to begin shooting in mid-SeptemberVetri Maaran's upcoming film starring Silambarasan TR aka Simbu, is confirmed to start shooting in September despite rumours of shelving and financial issues.

Jeremy Renner hints at return in Hawkeye 2 after fatal accident: I feel strongerActor Jeremy Renner is prepared to reprise his role as Hawkeye in the MCU after recovering from fatal snowmobile accident. He made a hint at returning to future Marvel projects as well.

Vidya Balan's debut film Parineeta to re-release in theatres after 20 yearsVidya Balan's iconic film 'Parineeta' is set to re-release in theatres. The film's comeback in theatres marks its 20th anniversary.

Kyunki Tulsi can't catch a break. New episode, old misogyny25 years later, Tulsi still wakes up the house while Mihir goes for a jog. It seems like patriarchy doesn't just survive, but gets a glow-up in 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' reboot.

When Kyunki reboot gave us serious Anupamaa vibes'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' reboot has premiered, starring Smriti Irani as Tulsi. Here's how the new show reminded us of Rupali Ganguly's 'Anupamaa'.

Sunny Deol to team up with Farhan Akhtar for next action film. Details insideActor Sunny Deol is reportedly set to star in a big-budget action film backed by Farhan Akhtar's Excel Entertainment. The shooting of the film is expected to begin in December.

general news.headline: India our friend but...: Trump imposes 25% tariff plus penalty for Russia tradeDonald Trump cited oil imports from Russia and said India has the "most strenuous and obnoxious non-monetary trade barriers" as he announced 25 per cent tariff as well penalty.

US imposes 25% tariff on India: What it means for exports and key sectorsThe newly announced duties target several of India's top-performing export sectors. Automobiles, auto components, steel, aluminum, smartphones, solar modules, marine products, gems, jewellery, and select processed food and agricultural items are all on the 25% list.

On Congress's demand for PM address, Amit Shah says 'mere se nipat lo'Opposition MPs staged a walkout from the Rajya Sabha after demanding Prime Minister Modi's presence in the House during the discussion on Operation Sindoor.

Kept quiet on insults: Congress slams PM Modi after Trump imposes 25% tariffJairam Ramesh took a dig at PM Modi over Trump's 25 per cent tariff announcement. He added that the PM should take inspiration from Indira Gandhi and stand up to the US President.

That's democracy, RahulThe issue of operational freedom to Indian forces came up during a debate on Operation Sindoor in Parliament. The Indian armed forces, unlike Pakistan's, work in a democratic country, where an elected civilian leadership is answerable to the people.

Live: Opposition walks out as Amit Shah begins Op Sindoor speech in Rajya SabhaParliament Session 2025 Live Updates: As the Monsoon Session of Parliament enters its eighth day on Wednesday, the Rajya Sabha is expected to witness key interventions by senior ministers, with External Affairs Minister Dr S Jaishankar expected to open the debate on Operation Sindoor at 1 pm, followed by Leader of the House JP Nadda around 3 pm. Union Home Minister Amit Shah is also likely to deliver the concluding speech in Parliament later in the day. The expected addresses come a day after high-voltage exchanges in both Houses, where Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Amit Shah led the government's offensive on the Operation Sindoor narrative. On the Opposition front, leaders including Rahul Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi, and Akhilesh Yadav attempted to mount a counterattack, questioning the government's handling of the India-Pakistan conflict. Stay tuned to IndiaToday.in as we bring you the latest updates.

Nisar launched: Billion-dollar mission to track Earth's changing pulseThe Nisar mission, a $1.5 billion joint venture between the Indian Space Research Organisation (Isro) and the United States' National Aeronautics and Space Administration (Nasa), is now set to revolutionise climate monitoring and disaster response, not just for India, but worldwide.
Dhankhar dhamaka: The inside story of what forced the vice-president outAmong the reasons: an impeachment motion against a judge, purported internal dissent and some power play

Ek chutki sindoor ki keemat...: Congress MP's filmy dig at PM in ParliamentWondering whether Prime Minister Modi understood the value of a pinch of sindoor, Congress MP from Telangana Renuka Chowdhury questioned why the 26 victims of the Pahalgam terror attack were not mentioned in his hour-and-a-half-long speech in the Lok Sabha on Tuesday.

Death most beautiful: CA buys helium for Rs 3,500, dies by suicide at Delhi AirbnbThe man, identified as Dheeraj Kansal, worked at a company in Gurugram and had sourced the gas from a supplier in Ghaziabad after searching for it on IndiaMART.

India officially withdraw from tournament after semi-final boycott vs PakistanWCL 2025: The Indian team has officially withdrawn from the tournament, which means that Pakistan would qualify for the final. Earlier, India Today learned that most Indian players were in favour of boycotting the match due to ongoing geopolitical tensions between the two countries.

More and more Indians everywhere? India largest source of emigrants nowIndia has the world's largest emigrant population, with over 18.5 million in the Indian diaspora as of 2024, which is 6% of global migrants, says the UN. Once concentrated in Saudi Arabia and Pakistan, the diaspora has shifted westward, reflecting trends in skilled migration, education, and long-term settlement in countries like the US, UAE, and Canada.

After 'Dog Babu', 'Dogesh Babu' applies for residence in Bihar; probe orderedThe application, dated July 29, has a picture of a furry dog, with parents called "dogesh ke papa" and "dogesh ki mummy". The incident—though somewhat humorous—has drawn the ire of Nawada's District Magistrate, who has ordered officials to probe the matter and identify those behind the application.

India has intensified proxy-war, says Munir as Baloch rebels hit Pak forces hardAs Baloch insurgents escalate deadly attacks on Pakistani forces and inflict casualties, Army Chief Asim Munir has blamed India for intensifying the unrest in the restive province. Munir said India's actions were a response to its "defeat in the Marka-e-Haq" war.  However, talk of a "proxy war" is the Pakistani establishment's old tactic.

How Pune man's insurance claim was denied thrice, then cleared after viral postWhile his wife was hospitalised, Sumit Kumar, a Pune-based business consultant, was battling paperwork, policy fine print, and silence from his insurer. This is his story.

Took tuitions from Chinese envoys: Jaishankar's 'China guru' jibe at Jairam RameshThe minister took a 'China guru' jibe at Jairam Ramesh for repeatedly making claims about China and Pakistan and highlighted how the country is today paying for the mistakes made during the Congress rule.

Caught on CCTV: Student dies after Assam actor Nandini Kashyap hits him with SUVAssamese actor Nandini Kashyap has been arrested for a hit-and-run incident that killed 21-year-old student Samiul Haque in Guwahati. Eyewitnesses claimed the vehicle did not stop after hitting him.

Man celebrates divorce with 'Zero Alimony' cake. Reddit post goes viralA man's divorce story - complete with a cake and no alimony - has triggered strong reactions on Reddit, after a friend shared how he fought his own legal battle and walked away on his own terms.

Is AI fluency the new English? Why prompt skills matter more nowAI fluency is emerging as a new essential skill beyond traditional English mastery. The focus on speaking and writing perfect English is slowly fading as even if you can't do it, AI can do it for you. This shift is impacting how people write, work, and express themselves.

Ben Stokes to miss 5th Test against India as England make four changes to playing XIBen Stokes will miss the Oval Test against England due to a shoulder injury as the hosts make four changes for the match against India. Along with Stokes, Jofra Archer has also been rested for the match against India.

Live: 3-feet waves hit California after Russia quake, Japan tsunami alert easedOne of the world's strongest earthquakes since 2011 struck Russia's Far East early Wednesday, with a powerful 8.8-magnitude tremor jolting the Kamchatka Peninsula and triggering tsunami alerts across the northern Pacific. The quake, the strongest in the region since 1952, was followed by intense aftershocks, with seismologists warning of further tremors up to magnitude 7.5 in the coming weeks. A tsunami wave hit North Kurilsk, flooding parts of the settlement and a local fishing facility. Evacuations were reported across Kamchatka, the Kuril Islands, and parts of Japan, while tsunami sirens sounded as far as Alaska, Hawaii, and even New Zealand.

Why idea of free-fair polls in Bengal is ghorar dimAt a recent meeting, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee reminded block-level officers (BLOs) that they were state government employees. Bengal is the only state to have a Chief Electoral Officer's office under the Home and Hill Affairs Department. These and large-scale illegal immigration make the dream of free-fair polls in Mamata's Bengal nothing but bunkum.

Co-star Adivi Sesh shared a glimpse of the celebration on social media.

sports.headline: Parthiv Patel brings IPL experience to Outer Delhi Warriors as mentor for DPL 2025Former India wicketkeeper batter Parthiv Patel is excited to manage the next-gen stars of Delhi for Outer Delhi Warriors in the 2nd season of the Delhi Premier League (DPL).

Priyansh Arya looking to break trophy curse in Delhi Premier League season 2Priyansh Arya is eyeing to break his trophy curse as he prepares himself to represent Outer Delhi Warriors in the Delhi Premier League 2025 (DPL 2025). Arya finished as runner-up in the inaugural edition of the tournament as East Delhi Riders beat South Delhi Superstarz by three runs.

West Indies vs Pakistan T20I series: Squads, all you need to knowWI vs PAK: West Indies and Pakistan will be looking to bounce back when they lock horns in their upcoming three-match T20I series, starting July 31 at the Central Broward Regional Park Stadium in Lauderhill.

Shubman Gill responds to Oval pitch row: No Instructions on 2.5-metre ruleIndia captain Shubman Gill has responded to the Oval pitch controversy involving head coach Gautam Gambhir and curator Lee Fortis, saying that they had no instructions about the 2.5 metre rule.

Jasprit Bumrah to play 5th Test vs England? Shubman Gill opens upENG vs IND, 5th Test: Skipper Shubman Gill opened up on whether Jasprit Bumrah would take the field in the fifth and final Test, starting July 31 at the Kennington Oval in London.

Shaw welcomes Amorim's no-nonsense approach to revive Manchester UnitedLuke Shaw reflecting on his time at the club believes that Ruben Amorim is the man to lead Manchester United back to winning ways.

Brendan Taylor added to Zimbabwe squad for 2nd Test after ban endsZIM vs NZ: Veteran wicketkeeper-batter Brendan Taylor has returned to international cricket in the second Test against New Zealand, marking his comeback nearly four years after serving a suspension that ended on July 25.

Risk was way too high: Ben Stokes disappointed after missing 5th TestENG vs IND: Skipper Ben Stokes said that it would have been too big a risk had he played the fifth Test against India at the KIA Oval with the shoulder injury.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
